hayeslib

Returns evenly spaced numbers.

This wraps seq trivially. What can I say, I like the Numpy API.

linspace(start, stop, num = 15)

Arguments

start

base^start is the starting value of the sequence
stop

base^stop is the final value in the sequence
num

Number of sequence elements to generate. Default is 15.

Value

Linearly spaced sequence from start to stop

Examples

linspace(-5, 5)
#>  [1] -5.0000000 -4.2857143 -3.5714286 -2.8571429 -2.1428571 -1.4285714
#>  [7] -0.7142857  0.0000000  0.7142857  1.4285714  2.1428571  2.8571429
#> [13]  3.5714286  4.2857143  5.0000000

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples
